outputs.name: mesh
outputs.description: The input _mesh that has been colored with results.

outputs.name: legend
outputs.description: Geometry representing the legend for the mesh.

outputs.name: title
outputs.description: A text object for the global_title.

outputs.name: colors
outputs.description: The colors associated with each input value.

outputs.name: legend_par
outputs.description:
The input legend parameters with defaults filled for
unset properties.

inputs.name: _values
inputs.description:
A list of numerical values with which to color the mesh.
The number of values must match the number of faces or vertices
in the mesh.

inputs.name: _mesh
inputs.description:
A Mesh object, with a number of faces or vertices that match
the number of input values and will be colored with restults.

inputs.name: offset_dom_
inputs.description:
Optional domain (or number for distance), which will
be used to offset the mesh faces or verticesto according to the
values. Higher values will be offset further.

inputs.name: legend_par_
inputs.description:
Optional legend parameters from the Ladybug
'Legend Parameters' component.

inputs.name: legend_title_
inputs.description:
A text string for Legend title. Typically, the units
of the data are used here but the type of data might also be used.
Default is an empty string.

inputs.name: global_title_
inputs.description:
A text string to label the entire mesh.  It will be
displayed in the lower left of the result mesh. Default is for no
title.

        lb_mesh = lb_mesh.height_field_mesh(_values, (dom_st, dom_end))
    graphic = GraphicContainer(_values, lb_mesh.min, lb_mesh.max, legend_par_)

    # generate titles
    if legend_title_ is not None:

    lb_mesh.colors = graphic.value_colors
    mesh = from_mesh3d(lb_mesh)
